Sprinkled in sweet songs and the defiant calls of loud living In sidewalks cracks filled with long green stalks spelling out the subtle strengths that have covered these landscapes for ages

In the soft snooze that comes with familiar entanglements under hand stitched blankets with tv fuzz filling the air spinning in two wheels with wind swept hair

This pours out of sleepy coffee cups you make me in the morning stirred in the chili pot that always has room for seconds
